content.question: Three identical forces of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> are applied to a meterstick that rests on a horizontal table, as shown in the diagram. At what location on the meterstick would a fourth force, also of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, need to be applied in order to establish static equilibrium?

topic.text: 5.5: Rotational Equilibrium and Newton's First Law in Rotational Form

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
